channel.title: Comments on: How to refresh the local IntelliSense cache in SQL Server Management Studio
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.description: Are you sure you don't have the Express version of management studio? I just checked with a 2008 R2 version and it looks the same for me
item.content:encoded: Are you sure you don’t have the Express version of management studio? I just checked with a 2008 R2 version and it looks the same for me

item.title: By: Shrini
item.dc:creator: Shrini
item.content:encoded:
Denis,

I have Management Studio 2008 R2. Basically, the image you have posted for the edit menu does not match mine. And of course the shortcut does not function. Is there something behind the scenes to look for to activate it.

I have gone through the Options > Keyboard > Keyboard scheme and switched between standard and sql 2000.

item.title: By: matt
item.dc:creator: matt
item.description: hey, thanks! i've been looking for that for a while now!
item.content:encoded: hey, thanks! i’ve been looking for that for a while now!

item.title: By: chopstik
item.dc:creator: chopstik
item.content:encoded:
I have been using RedGate at the office and have found it to be pretty useful. It wasn’t until recently that I discovered the trick for updating the info in RedGate is Ctrl-Shift-D – for those that may use it.

Thanks for the info, Denis. I always prefer to know the keyboard shortcuts when possible…
